thread.title: Raquan Mitchell enrolled; Kedren Johnson day-to-day
thread.title_full: Raquan Mitchell enrolled; Kedren Johnson day-to-day

author: Jason Smith
title: Raquan Mitchell enrolled; Kedren Johnson day-to-day
text:
Former Texas A&M commitment Raquan Mitchell has been cleared to play for the University of Memphis this season and practiced with the Tigers on Monday night, a source said.
Mitchell, a 6-foot-3 combo guard and former Miami (Florida) Southridge High standout, will take the Tigers' last open scholarship and joins a 2015 Memphis recruiting class that includes three other first-year combo guards.
Mitchell averaged 22 points and five rebounds as a senior at Southridge and had at one point planned to attend prep school, his high school coach, John Herron, said Monday.
But Mitchell chose to rejoin the 2015 class and had a good July on the AAU circuit with the Showtime Ballers, impressing teams like Memphis and Texas A&M that still had room on their roster for an explosive guard.
Mitchell committed to the Aggies after an official visit in early August, but he wasn't cleared by the NCAA in time to enroll for the fall semester, Herron said. He had until Wednesday to enroll at Memphis, which has four freshman guards on scholarship in Mitchell, Jeremiah Martin, Randall Broddie and Craig Randall.
"He's a good kid. As long as he's happy, I'm happy. That's my whole thing," Herron said. "He's probably (got) a 38(-inch vertical). He can get up."
With Mitchell now in the fold at Memphis, 247Sports.com bumped the Tigers' 2015 recruiting class up three spots to No. 12 nationally. Coach Josh Pastner has declined comment on the addition of Mitchell.
Johnson day-to-day with shoulder injury
Pastner said senior guard Kedren Johnson is day-to-day with shoulder soreness and that he probably won't know more on Johnson's status for the season until later this month.
Johnson is facing potential season-ending shoulder surgery. But he could choose to put off the surgery and play this season if he can tolerate the pain.
For now, Johnson, who had been projected as the Tigers' starting point guard, isn't participating in full-contact drills. With him out, the Tigers are looking at three players to handle point guard duties in his absence â€” senior Ricky Tarrant, sophomore Markel Crawford and Martin.
Johnson isn't the only injured Tiger. Junior guard/forward Jake McDowell has missed parts of practice with knee soreness and Pastner said junior guard Avery Woodson hyperextended his knee in drills Sunday.
"We're a little banged up here and there," Pastner said. "Jake can practice in spurts because he's got some knee issues. Avery had a hyperextension of his knee, but nothing serious. He'll miss (practice) Monday and Tuesday."
Rebounders hosting luncheon Today
The Memphis Rebounders are hosting a coaches luncheon today at 11:30 a.m. at the Penny Hardaway Hall of Fame on the U of M campus. All of the players will attend the luncheon, Pastner said.
For information on the event, to sign up or to join the Rebounders, go to MemphisRebounders.com.
